item.title: Recursive Calls in C#: A Deep Dive
item.description: Recursion functions are like a magical mirror that reflects upon itself. It’s a concept where a function calls itself, creating a mesmerizing loop of self-referential elegance. Let’s break it down how recursive functions works using Factorial Calculation as sample. What is a Factorial? Before we dive into the code, let’s unravel the mystery of factorials. A factorial of a non-negative integer N, denoted as N!, is the product of all positive integers from 1 to N.
